name: GenderDysphoria
title: Gender Dysphoria
description:
This value set emphasizes the current terminology (gender dysphoria) for diagnostic purposes.

The inclusion of historical terms acknowledges past classifications but discourages their use in current clinical practice.

The focus is on the distress associated with gender incongruence, not on a person's gender identity or expression.
purpose:
(Clinical Focus: This value set focuses on  gender dysphoria, the distress a person may feel when their gender identity does not match their assigned sex at birth. It acknowledges historical terminology but emphasizes the current understanding of gender dysphoria.),(Data Element Scope: This data element captures the presence of gender dysphoria as a clinical diagnosis. It does not specify the individual's gender identity or expression.),(Inclusion Criteria: Concept Codes:
Gender dysphoria (preferred term)
Historical Terms (for informational purposes only):
Gender identity disorders (used in past diagnostic manuals)
Transsexualism (older term, may be offensive to some)
Dual role transvestism (outdated term)
Gender identity disorder of childhood (replaced by gender dysphoria in recent diagnostic manuals)
Other gender identity disorders (broad category from past classifications)
Gender identity disorder, unspecified (unspecific diagnosis from past classifications)),(Exclusion Criteria: This value set does not include concepts related to sexual orientation.
It excludes details on specific treatments or interventions for gender dysphoria.)
